title: Amma's Chicken 'Chaaps'
subtitle: Spicy and comforting chicken curry from home.

ingredients.note: Divide into two halves: one quartered and the other diced
Or a few dried chili peppers
Optional, but my mom always adds it

instructions.text: Clean the chicken and cut into large pieces. Set aside.
instructions.note: I prefer cutting one chicken thigh into 2 or 3 pieces.

instructions.text: Heat 1 Tbsp ghee in a heavy-bottomed pressure cooker over medium heat. Add half an onion (quartered), garlic, and ginger. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add peppercorns, cashews, and curry leaves. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until aromatic.
Transfer to a blender. Add cumin powder, red chili powder, raisins, coriander powder, garam masala, yogurt, cilantro, and mint. Blend until smooth.
instructions.note: We use a NutriBullet. The resulting paste should look very green from the herbs.

instructions.text: In the same pan, heat 1 Tbsp butter. For the 'oggarne', add half a diced onion, fenugreek leaves, cardamom, cloves, fennel seeds, and cinnamon. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add chicken and salt. Sear on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Add the blended masala. Mix well. Simmer on low heat with the lid on for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally. Enjoy my favorite dish!

story: Growing up, I could smell this masala from several houses away. We always called it 'chaaps'. I never knew why, and I still don't. Someone once told me it comes from 'chops,' but this is really a curry. When T and I decided to start eating meat again, this was the first thing I wanted to make. I've made it over 20 times now, but it never tastes quite like Amma's. I probably just need to be a bit more with the chili powder :)
